definition[0]: to sell goods or a service at a lower price than another company
example[0]: Online bookstores can undercut retailers by up to 30%.
definition[1]: to make something weaker or less effective
example[1]: Is a lack of self-confidence undercutting your performance at work?
definition[2]: to sell goods or services more cheaply than another company
example[2]: Our competitors have been undercutting our prices.
example[3]: The firm that expands output will always be able to reduce costs and undercut its rivals.
